description: The Clean Water Act of 1972 establishes a framework for water pollution control but lacks comprehensive equity considerations.
summary: The Clean Water Act focuses on pollution control and water quality. While it enables federal oversight and provides mechanisms for public participation, it does not explicitly address equity. Implementation tends to favor well-resourced communities, leaving marginalized groups underrepresented and underserved.
mitigationStrategies: Policy revisions to include EJ provisions

description: Outlines strategies for heat resilience in underserved neighborhoods.
summary: This policy proposes interventions to reduce urban heat in vulnerable neighborhoods, focusing on increasing green spaces and improving infrastructure to protect at-risk populations.

description: Policy for equitable access to public transit.
summary: Aims to ensure all community members have affordable and reliable access to public transportation, reducing barriers for marginalized groups.

description: A policy to improve air quality in urban centers through stricter emissions standards and community monitoring.
summary: This initiative enforces stricter air pollution controls and funds community-led air quality monitoring, prioritizing neighborhoods with historically poor air quality.

description: Community-based program to promote water conservation practices in drought-prone regions.
summary: This program educates and empowers residents in drought-affected areas to adopt water-saving techniques, with special focus on communities facing water insecurity.
